website_summaries.verdict: Choose this well-made bottle brush if you don't need a large set but just one that's reliable and practical. Cleans many types of bottles, tall containers, and dishware.
pros: Offers a feature set that makes it easy to use, including a 12-inch length, slip-resistant grip, and durable top
Has a combination of stiff and soft bristles to tackle different cleaning chores
Safe to wash in the dishwasher
cons: Bristles on the very top are a bit sparse
Metal around the bristles may rust over time
Top won't fit in very narrow bottles

customer_reviews.title: At first I loved this brush
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this brush, as it was exactly what I needed & works perfectly to clean all sizes of bottles. Unfortunately rust stains have appeared at the base of the bristles! At first they looked like they had food stains, but to my dismay the stains are in fact rust! Totally unacceptable for a kitchen tool & a complete waste of $. Don"t buy this product, no quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Angels2b

customer_reviews.title: too soft
customer_reviews.text: I use it to wash dishes off before they go in the dishwasher...I will throw it away and buy a Rubbermaid bottle brush lik I have before, I should have sent it back but decided to give it a try.........waste of money dont buy it......I have an OXO toilet brush and it works great???????
customer_reviews.author: E. Money

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good scrub bottle brush, for my needs at least. The bristles are way too soft, they feel softer than a newborn baby brush. This still does clean but not if you have something stubborn to remove like dried on foods.
customer_reviews.author: VerifiedBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Brushes Bottles
customer_reviews.text: It's a bottle brush. It has a good grip. The handle is long enough to be useful. It's better than rubber-banding a sponge to the end of a salad fork for cleaning coffee travel mugs, (my previous method).
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: Washing bottles is easier and faster with this OXO brush.
customer_reviews.text: I have a drawer full of brushes. But this one is the best. I like everything about this bottle brush. It has more bristles than my other bottle brushes making the washing easier, faster and much more thorough. I wash a lot of bottles. My other brushes make my wrist hurt. Not this brush. The grip on this brush is thicker with good texture. It's not slick or slippery like a hard plastic or metal grip. It fits comfortably in the hand. The handle has a hole for hanging the brush up. OXO put a lot of thought into the design of this brush. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Poplaski

customer_reviews.title: Good length and durable bristles
customer_reviews.text: This OXO bottle brush is good all around. It has a good length and can be used for more than cleaning just baby bottles. The handle grip is soft and the shaft is slightly bendable. This bottle brush does not come with a nipple cleaner so if that is something you need as part of the brush you will need to seek an alternative brush.
customer_reviews.author: JSV

customer_reviews.title: First bad OXO review, yuck!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was replacing my OXO brush and bought this one. But I was mistaken. I originally had a Quicky brush. This OXO brush is skimpy, wimpy and weak. The handle spins all around in your wet hand. Yuck. I went and dug the Quicky mop out of the trash, washed it, and put it back in service. I got my Quicky brush here at Amazon, check it out, and consider it instead. It even has a handle that is easy to hold on to. It's much stronger, and bushier!
customer_reviews.author: NIS

customer_reviews.title: Good for stainless steel bottles
customer_reviews.text: Fits snugly through 1.25” opening of a typical 17-oz. stainless steel water bottle. You might be able to force it through a 1” opening, but you’d likely lose bristles. Works well and has a nonslip handle.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not like they made in the past
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a baby bottle brush, but no one has the good old fation brush. This is too modern aned too stiff. the new stuff doesn't work as well, it won't bend and the bristles are in the wrong place or at the wrong angle. Hate to return all I buy. New isn't always good.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: very flimsy bristles
customer_reviews.text: I got this very highly rated brush to replace a brush that broke... we had the brush that broke for years. This OXO brush has so many excellent reviews- I dont know how- as the bristles are super flimsy, and are already loosing their shape and falling out after cleaning only 10 or so reusable water bottles. I would save your money and get a brush with bristles that will actually last. In the mean time, if you have one to suggest, I would love it if you could tell me which one to get!
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camel bottles.
customer_reviews.text: Don't ask me why, but I never bothered cleaning the bottom of my camelback waterbottle for over 4 months. My hand is pretty massive and I never really bothered reaching into the bottom half of my bottle. However, one day I noticed my water tasted funky and I decided to take a chopstick, put a tissue on it, and swivel it around... Yeah, the tissue came up stark black. Panicked, I immediately purchased this and spent the next 4 hours scrubbing the entire bottle until I was sure I took about a millimeter of the plastic off. My water tasted great from then on. Buy one of these and save yourself the panic attack...
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: OXO Brand = Dollar Store Product
customer_reviews.text: What happened to the high quality trustworthy OXO brand? This is the third time I ordered the OXO bottle brush. I was surprised and disappointed to see that it had totally changed in quality and materials. The new brush is totally cheap and plastic think Dollar Store but with OXO price tag. OXO what happened?
customer_reviews.author: NC Mom

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush to use for pre-cleaning/rinsing dishes before they go in the dishwasher. HUGE MISTAKE. I'm shocked at the positive reviews and I should have listened to the negative ones. The bristles really are softer than a baby brush. In fact, you are better off using a baby brush since it will have more bristles and be more compact. Any brush is better than this one and I'm convinced that the positive reviews are fake, fake, FAKE! It's not even worth the effort to return. Money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this is a great bottle brush. The ones with the little sponges start flaking and falling apart pretty quickly, but this sucker has been a durable scrubber of many bottles now for weeks. Nice sized handle, with a blue area on the brush that will wear down over time and tell you when it's time for a new one. OXO makes really good kitchen gadgets, so you know you're getting a quality piece of plastic here. No complaints and heartily recommend!
customer_reviews.author: The Huntington Book Depository

customer_reviews.title: Sprays soap suds!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: light, flexible, good length. CONS: the bristles are too stiff (??) and end up spraying soap droplets all over me and the kitchen. Well, I like OXO. And I like the Oxo bottlebrush I bought at a CVS in Twin Falls, Idaho on my way to Yellowstone. It had many more bristles than this brush and they were less inflexible, and the definitely did not spray soap drops all over me and my kitchen. So, this'll do until I get back to Twin Falls.
customer_reviews.author: John H Gruver

customer_reviews.title: Good solid brush
customer_reviews.text: Overall good bottle brush. We have purchased a second after heavy use of the first. -Well constructed brush with solid bristles that have lasted. -It is easy and comfortable to hold. -solid: you can put pressure against a surface to clean and it does not bend in a way that impairs cleaning Downsides -no way to have it stand up on its own if you want that -limited ability to get to small diameter spaces (e.g., the center of a food processor bowel).
customer_reviews.author: Tortuga V.

customer_reviews.title: A soft brush that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I had a silicone brush that basically fell apart after a few uses so I purchased this brush instead. The bristles are very soft, not like the hard and stiffer bristles of some baby bottle brushes, but I have to say, it doesn't affect it's ability to scrub things clean. The handle is somewhat flexible, so it has a bit of give which allows you to angle the brush better to clean. And bc the bristles are soft, it makes it easier to fit into narrow bottle openings. So far I am happy with my purchase! It cleans really well without damaging any of the prints you may have on your water bottles or cups.
customer_reviews.author: Sanriobaby

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: My recommendation...go to Target and buy their Scotch Bright bottle brush. It costs the same if not less and most importantly the brush is much stiffer and actually cleans. This product had very, very flimsy bristles and did not perform as I wanted it to. Not sure how a bottle brush with incredibly flimsy bristles is supposed to actually clean out the inside of water bottles, coffee pots, and other items that I cannot put into the dishwasher and cannot get my hand inside. Bottom line...this item was a waste of my money and I tossed it in the trash after Finding the perfect bottle brush at Target.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Clean bottles
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bottle brush. The only drawback is that I wish the bristles made a wider base for large mouth bottles. I especially like that there is no metal wire attaching the bristles so there will never be any rust or breakage. If you are looking for something with more flexibility then this is not the bottle brush for you.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary J. Bello

customer_reviews.title: We found so many uses after receiving
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in the kitchen We wanted it primary to clean glass humming birds feeders. We're going to order another one for the kitchen Handle is comfortable to hold its easy to clean and pretty sturdy I may just buy the 3 pack We found uses for it in the kitchen garage laundry room. We don't want to contaminate the brushes A bottle brush? Who'd of thought we'd get excited about bottle brushes conversing of all our chores made easier?
customer_reviews.author: Kathy G.

customer_reviews.title: Might work for baby bottles,  otherwise move along,  this isn't the brush you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: All around pretty useless, I'd have returned it but at the price it wasn't worth the time and effort. I was looking for a bottle brush to clean out cycling drink bottles, this isn't it. The label claims to have "stiff" brushes get into corners... I'm guessing they need brush viagra as that wasn't any kind of useful stiff. Might work for baby bottles, otherwise move along, this isn't the brush you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cathcart

customer_reviews.title: Fits Tight Neck Bottles!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. it fits into the small bottle holes as some of the other buyers have pictured, which was a huge surprise to me! I actually felt like it should have a little more bristle upwards (looks a little like a tiny toilet want honestly, which is not appealing) However I've used in bottles and it works perfectly it seems. Just a little soap and suds away and I can finally clean tight neck bottles. Its not as flexible on the handles as some people have mentioned, but overall this ddi the the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cindia Y

customer_reviews.title: But it if you need it, don’t if you don’t.
customer_reviews.text: It’s exactly what the name says: a brush for my bottles. Relatively flexible head and I guess it’s got a comfort grip. Didn’t buy it for either of those reasons though. I just needed a brush for my bottles and didn’t want to drive somewhere just for that. So here we are. Me, standing at the kitchen sink brushing my bottles. You, reading reviews about a bottle brush instead of trusting your gut instincts about such a contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Something witty this way comes

customer_reviews.title: Too Soft and Bristles not Dense Enough
customer_reviews.text: Based on my good experience with other OXO products I was expecting this to be significantly more heavy duty than it actually is. The bristles are way too soft except for a small cluster at the top and they are too sparsely distributed. This does not do a very good job cleaning anything that wouldn't already lift off from soaking. I have old baby bottle brushes that do a far better job but I ordered this one because I needed something a little longer. Unfortunately this might get tossed in the draw with other useless utensils.
customer_reviews.author: javabill999

customer_reviews.title: Bristles not stiff enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my insulated water bottles and coffee thermoses. It wasn’t terrible and it was nice and easy to hold, but I found the bristles - even the stiffer ones on the end - were too flexible and too sparse to actually scrub anything. They do great if whatever you’re cleaning isn’t stuck on, but if you’re looking to scrub off something that’s actually dirty, try another brush.
customer_reviews.author: C. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Does What We Bought It For
customer_reviews.text: We needed a bottle brush for our Rtic bottles and not use our baby's bottle brush. We're big on preventing cross contamination and all that. The brush does a great job cleaning the Rtic bottles and covers a big surface area so that it doesn't take a lot of time to clean the bottles. Now we just need to find a proper way to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon from NY

customer_reviews.title: After one month of use..
customer_reviews.text: I read so many great reviews, but for me, this bush did not last. I used it for a month and the bristles are all matted. I use this brush 3-4 times a day to clean baby bottles and expected this brand to perform better than what is available on the market. I also noticed some orange color at holes where the bristles are coming out of, and after reading other negative reviews, I am think ing it could be rust. Highly disappointed in this brush after one month of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Karen V.

customer_reviews.title: flimsy handle
customer_reviews.text: This brush may be useful for bottles, but not for general dish cleaning. The bristles are too soft for a proper wash. The flexible handle seems a little too flimsy. I have since purchased one with more substantial bristles and a stainless handle... much better.
customer_reviews.author: Art lover

customer_reviews.title: Well made brush. Not for hard cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: Summary; This is a well-made brush that is worth it for the price. The come in a pack of 2, and work well for light cleaning. Pros: 1) Well-made construction. 2) Made for light cleaning like baby bottles. Cons: 1) Not for heavy duty cleaning. 2) Bristles may be too soft for some users. 3) Not as many bristles as I would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly effective.
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was that this brush was going to be too soft to effectively clean tough food mess. An example is preparing canned dog food cans for recycling, where they have to be very clean here in San Diego . To my surprise, this beautiful little brush got the thick and sticky dog food remnants off the can far better than my old, much firmer and larger Rubbermade brushes, and far faster and easier. Excellence has been my experience with all OXO kitchen product I've purchased. I strongly recomend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Wings42

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 8 years
customer_reviews.text: I was just searching for bottle brushes to clean my narrow mouth hummingbird feeder, and when I clicked on this one, which I already own. Amazon informed me I purchased it in 2012. So, I have had this brush for 8 years, and it is still my go-to brush for all of my hydroflasks (every size, including 64-oz growler and 40-oz bottle), Yetis, and hummingbird feeders (just not my stupid cheap new one that the mouth is smaller than a 20oz soda bottle). I just throw it in the dishwasher, and it is brand new! Has outlasted all other brushes, even some by OXO. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Robinson

customer_reviews.title: A great scrubbing brush for any item
customer_reviews.text: OXO sets the standards with all of their products and this is simply the best bottle brush out there. I use it for my baby's glass milk bottles and it gets the sour smell out and cleans the cloudy stains off perfectly. It's comfortable to hold and long enough to reach the bottom of skinny flower vases and my wine carafe, which I could never get all the way clean and was about to toss until I decided to get this brush. It's held up well for me and seems to be made of durable material, with a comfortable grip on the handle. A great brush for the price!
customer_reviews.author: 14ner

customer_reviews.title: Super handy bottle brush
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of this Oxo brush for about ten years. Wore it out. Bought this replacement. The design has changed slightly. The old version had an inflexible metal shaft. The new plastic shaft has just a bit of flex but is stiff enough for scrubbing the inside of jars. I'm pleased. Same easy-grasp handle. Bristles with authority but not so stiff you can't get it in a narrow opening. This brush gets frequent use on Klean Kanteens, Mason jars, and flower vases. It really does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great pre-dishwasher quickie brush!
customer_reviews.text: MUCH better than bacteria-infested sponges, I really like the bristles on this brush for general dish cleaning, both for washing right after eating and to get glops or crumbs off dishes before loading into machine. Bristles are softer than the almost-identical Rubbermaid (with its much stiffer bristles which sounds good but doesn't get into corners as well). And every couple of days I just stick the brush into top rack dishwasher. A whole lot more sanitary all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Cheap version of Oxo bottle brush
customer_reviews.text: Found a better bottle brush for 3.00 less in the grocery store. This brush was much smaller than my old one, with soft, short, sparse bristles. No good for scrubbing. Not worth returning. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Serving Tea

customer_reviews.title: Bristles Just a little too flimsy and weak and needs more bristles
customer_reviews.text: This brush reaches as far as you should need it. Easy to hold. BUT THE BRISTLES ARE VERY THIN AND SOFT AND TOO SPREAD OUT. SOMETIMES YOU ATE RUBBING THE PLASTIC AGAINST WHAT TPU ARE TRYING TO CLEAN INSTEAD OF THE BRISTLES. INSTEAD OF THE TIPS OF THE BRUSH POKING AND SCRUBBING, they just curl, bend, roll, and spread out. It would be great if the bristles were a little more sturdy and maybe about double the amount of bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning my Chemex
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a brush to scrub my Chemex with that would be lightweight so as not to break the glass and also long enough to reach inside the coffee glass. This OXO bottle brush works just right and scrubs it well. The price was right - I almost want to buy another one just so I can have one exclusively for my coffee machine. Glad to have this quality product in my arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: carloseats

customer_reviews.title: Good For Narrow Mouth Bottles
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t a bad bottle brush, but there are a couple ways it could be improved. The bristles aren’t very stiff which makes it great for getting into narrow mouth bottles, but bad for wide mouth and scrubbing stickier problems. As others have noted, it is a little short. In my 32oz bottle it goes all the way to the handle. So I recommend for narrow mouth bottles, but for wide mouth may want to look else where.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H

customer_reviews.title: This is A  W I N N E R
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic brush. The best brush I have ever tried for bottles. I have a display of brushes hanging on the wall, to prove to me that after buying 9 different brands, at varying prices, this one is golden. Lots of bristles, soft so they do not scratch plastic, the wand is pliable, well, it has a give, so you can bend it slightly and rub stubborn food away.This brush looks large, but it fits most bottles thanks to the softer bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Irit

customer_reviews.title: Your water bottle may thank you
customer_reviews.text: If you've got heavy duty goop in your canteen of choice, I'd opt for something with stiffer bristles. I know this, because it isn't quite hefty enough to take care of my coffee schmoo on the bottom of my travel mug. It works great for softer gunk, though. It lives next to my sponge, will accept recommendations for burly bristled brushes to supplement this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: perfect for cleaning protein powder out of your water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I use this for cleaning protein powder from my optifast shakes out of my water bottle. Darn that stuff really sticks! the only suggestion is that you HIDE this brush afterwards because I found my husband cleaning out dog food cans and such with MY bottle brush. Yuck. It's the perfect brush for bottles - don't let others get at it!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C. Hand

customer_reviews.title: The best $5 ever spent!!
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning my hydro flask 22ounce coffee mug is very hard bc the coffee stains the bottom.. but this brush....it’s magical. It cleans so well I’ve never seen my mug so clean!! The brush is soft but effective and even fits in my smaller hydroflask that has a smaller neck. Highly recommend. Hydroflask tries to sell one for $20+ this $5 one works great.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: NOT KIDDING, GREAT BATH BRUSH
customer_reviews.text: For years I had a wonderful bath brush and of all the brushes the company made they stopped making the one I had. I ordered several bath brushes and the bristles were either too hard or too soft. Finally I said what do I have to lose because the OXO Good Grips bottle brush was inexpensive. I am 5'3" 115 lbs and this brush is the perfect length to reach every area of my body. I put my body wash in my hand and rub it on the brush. It gives a great back scrub and massage without being abrasive. I also use it on my arms, legs, and feet. It is really a great bath brush.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Bo

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well, not too big.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for washing my insulated water bottles (Yeti, Pelican, Corkcicle, Swell, RTIC, etc) and Mason jars. It's comfortable and not too big. Fits easily in my 5" wide x 20" sponge drawer. Holds a good lather, and cleans all the grime out well. Recommended for baby bottles, jars, and other hard to clean vessels.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony William Schillaci

customer_reviews.title: The new one is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these brushes about eight years ago and it was great. I ordered another one hoping for the same thing and found that not only were there fewer bristles but they also came out very easily. They would get stuck in little areas handful right out! I feel like this brush has considerably less clean power.
customer_reviews.author: magic mike

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased these and after a few uses I was looking to purchase a new one that works better. Bristles are super soft and very spaced out. I would have never known this was OXO brand, as I would have expected more. I love this brands products and when I do replace in the near future I will probably look to purchase on of their other brushes (a different one).
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: OXO, What happened to you?
customer_reviews.text: We’re huge OXO fans at our house because typically you know what you’ll be getting; a great product that will last. Sadly, this one was designed by the interns. The bristles are SO SOFT; you’d be better off whispering to your bottles on a misty day. Also, after a month or so, the base of the bristles started developing a rusty brown color. After many rounds of soaking in bleach and even vinegar, the stains kept overtaking the brush. We’re chucking this one and re-thinking our unchecked Stanning of the OXO brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Soft bristles; Don’t expect to clean day old protein powder from the bottom of a shaker.
customer_reviews.text: OXO has, usually, superb products; in this one I found it to be lacking. I purchased this with the main intent of being used to clean my protein shakers and tall skinny tumblers. The bristles are too soft to perform this duty. It works fine for my water bottles that get a weekly swish because I only tote water in them, but for deep cleaning it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Laila Ann

customer_reviews.title: Water bottles are clean !
customer_reviews.text: I use this for so much more than I thought I would. I had a thermos in mind but its by my sink and is the go to inside washer. I actually have abused my first one on some hot skillet cleaning and had to buy another, but aside from the heat, this is a work horse. (no not horse hair) Buy it, use it, review it.
customer_reviews.author: Wink

customer_reviews.title: Soap dispensing button failed after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: New brush version has cheap soap dispensing button. Failed after one year of use. I loved my previous version of this brush (which broke due to an accident.) This version seemed like an improvement with the addition of the water capture cup. I love that it dispenses soap. The downfall to this brush is that the push button on the brush has failed after 1 year of use. Rendering the the soap dispensing useless. The old version of this brush I owned was more than 5 years old, with no failure of the button. Seems like the new brush button is cheaper version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits in to clean my reusable water bottle
customer_reviews.text: So necessary to keep my water bottle clean! I’ve been trying to clean out my aluminum water bottle for weeks- using baking soda and vinegar, boiling water, dish soap; nothing was getting what ring of mold around the bottom and I didn’t have anything to fit down there to manually clean it. This did just the trick, long enough to reach the bottom and skinny enough to fit through the narrows bottle neck. Perfectly clean in a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Bristles fall out!
customer_reviews.text: I usually love OXO products, but after using this for only a couple of weeks, the little plastic bristles are falling out! I took a sip of a drink from a cup I just washed with it and drank one of the bristles out of the cup! Luckily, I didn’t swallow it. I won’t buy this bottle brush again!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia N.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulously charming brush!
customer_reviews.text: Needed brush for new bicycle water bottle. Hmm...does that mean new bike, or new bottle? Needed brush for new water bottle, for new bike. Have been wondering about something. 'Wondering why I didn't get one of these brushes a long time ago. Resides near kitchen sink. Helps clean lots of stuff...mainly, 77mm diameter, 12 inch long, Walmart purchased TAL water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Well
customer_reviews.text: It's smaller than I thought and yet doesn't fit in my small-necked bottles, However, I'm using it not as a bottle brush but just to clean/scrub things such as my Vita Mix container, even some pans that I don't want to scratch but need food scrubbed off (egg, for instance) It really does the job and cleans off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous bottle brush
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about OXO products when it comes to their grips/handles. I'm disabled with hand/grip problems and I've not found any other brand that works better than OXO. I was a nurse for 40 years so I feel good in recommending OXO products for this reason alone but also buy other OXO products because of quality.
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy basic does the job kind of brush!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a one piece sturdy no fuss brush, was this too much to ask? It seemed like it until I found this one. My old brush was “fancy” with a smaller brush that can be pulled out of its handle. Such a pain as it would separate and fall apart in the middle of cleaning then it’s impossible to hold. Grateful whenever I use it!
customer_reviews.author: It's Just Me

customer_reviews.title: but this one slides in easily. I think they may have angled the end ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these I've purchased, the first finally died. This one seems to be an improvement on a previous version. I'm still not sure what the did. I know they made the shaft thinner because I had to force the old one into a jar I wash often, but this one slides in easily. I think they may have angled the end bristles up a little more, or added some, since it hits the bottom and gets into a tiny dimple at the bottom of the aforementioned jar much easier than the old one. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: someguy

customer_reviews.title: Soft brush for plastic and narrow mouth bottles
customer_reviews.text: Softest bristles for minimal scratching of plastic? Also fit into narrow neck bottles. I use the Oxo GG Brush tool for on my plastic water bottles (of which the Oxo Strive Elevate bottle is my favorite). I recommend for bottle neck sized no smaller than 1.0 in. (26mm) inside. Bristles are all soft, so good for plastic bottles, as well as metal or glass.
customer_reviews.author: TimP

customer_reviews.title: Love this brush
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST bottle cleaning brush I've ever owned. I always hate when I'm cleaning a bottle and I am bringing the brush out of the bottle and it splatters on me! This does not happen with this brush. I like that the handle flexes as that makes cleaning easier. I will definitely purchase this brush again!
customer_reviews.author: Brandandi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and love the bristles on the end.
customer_reviews.text: This brush is great and at a very good price. Most brushes like this don't have bristles at the end. We bought it to clean a container that can't be reached with basic scrubbers because of the shape but wanted to get a good clean at the very bottom. The bristles at the end provide that! I highly recommend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Mary P

customer_reviews.title: How did I live so long without this.
customer_reviews.text: Very effective for all kitchen hand washing including non-stick pots, silverware, plates, mugs, knives, cutting boards as well as bottles. Calling it a " bottle brush" does not do it justice. Liberation from the grimy sponge changed my dread of hand washing. This is really big since I don't have a dishwasher in my tiny NY apartment.
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: The Old Style Bottle Brush is Just as Good as the Oxo
customer_reviews.text: I compared this new OXO bottle brush with my old one. The OXO has only 3 inches of brush's but the older bottle brush has the entire length of brush's about 4 1/2 inches. The OXO has a good grip handle making it comfortable to use but all in all, they both worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Baazumi

customer_reviews.title: Way too soft for anything I can imagine using it for
customer_reviews.text: I think the soft side of a sponge would have similar abrasive levels to this brush. It will be useless for removing any kind of buildup or anything stuck to a surface. If you can't just wipe the surface clean, this brush probably won't be able to clean it off.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to clean Sodastream bottles but find myself reaching for it to clean teapots and other travel cups and bottles. It fits in narrow openings and is long enough to reach the bottom of a tall travel mug. Rinses clean easily or will go in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: KellyMI

customer_reviews.title: As described, no issues
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this a ton yet, but I've used it a few times on my nalgene and other bottles. The bristles are relatively soft, which I am happy with as they don't seem to damage the bottles at all. The handle is nice. As for longevity, I cannot speak of yet but if it breaks or wears prematurely, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Hand saver
customer_reviews.text: I love this brush! I bought it so that I would be able to clean my water bottles and travel mugs without destroying my hand trying to reach inside to clean them. This works perfectly. It is the perfect length so you don’t have to worry about squeezing your hands through the top of the bottle or mug and the bristles are soft allowing you to thoroughly clean without scratching the surfaces. The handle also has a solid grip so you can control the brush even with soapy hands. I’ve had this brush for two weeks now and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Ada8705

customer_reviews.title: Fits in our waterbottles
customer_reviews.text: I needed a brush that would get in our stainless steel water bottles, not just the wide necked ones, but also the regular opening ones. This brush works perfectly. Its handle is long enough to easily reach the bottom of the inside of our 24 oz hydro flask bottles, I can finally feel like they're entirely clean!
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Durable and effective brush
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite dish brush. It is not for food that has dried on or burned on. It's great for removing the excess food before putting dishes, glasses, and jars in the dishwasher. I live alone and don't run the dishwasher often. I've never had a dishwasher that removed dried on food. I also find it very durable, as long as you don't abuse it - use it to swish off the food reasonably soon after you eat and it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Crager

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lil scrubber
customer_reviews.text: I just got my brush...I use it to clean dishes before putting in the dishwasher and to clean my sink....I am super excited about this scrubber. It feels way more durable than the one i am replacing. The head has lots of bristles, so i expect it to clean really well. It is a solid handle so it doesn't feel flimsy. It seems very well made, and comes with eco friendly packaging (not too much for a little thing).
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST you will not be disappointed I PROMISE!!
customer_reviews.text: the BEST bottle brush hands down! No matter the size, from baby bottles to my children Kleen canteen bottles and stainless steel thermoses, as well as my glass miu bottles! Super soft bristles doesn't scratch any surface and cleans superbly, every single time. When I've retired using them as bottle cleaning brushes I then use them to clean my toilet bowl as it cleans that wonderfully too! So I get one brush and it serves 2 purposes! Doesn't scratch porcelain either! The handle is pretty long which makes it ideal to clean larger bottles, long narrow containers and later on the porcelain God! No kidding this is the best investment!
customer_reviews.author: Mersoul

customer_reviews.title: Soft brush
customer_reviews.text: The overall size of the brush is good. I'm using it to clean my Contigo travel mug and my Ninja blender cup. I would have rated 5, but the brush bristles are soft like a baby brush. This brush is not good for hard scrubbing, but is good for a soft cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Tealer

customer_reviews.title: favorite
customer_reviews.text: It works so amazing! It is kinda big but it reaches the bottom of bottles so much better and the soft bristles don't scratch anything! I love that about it. and the bristles are long enough that all the corners get scrubbed. I buy a new one every half a year because of normal discoloration you get after a while but the old one is not being used to scrub the tub before each use. So not heavy duty stuff but just to get dust and the water ring off before using it. (so easy! and it doesn't scratch!) I will continue to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Ieuna Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad choice
customer_reviews.text: Oxo puts out a great product. I have many of their devices and find them of good quality. However I bought this to clean my water bottles and found the neck was too small for this brush. Make sure your cleaner will fit the size neck you want to clean. I didn't. But it was such a great product I kept it in case I do buy a bottle with a larger neck.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bottle Brush!!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased this for washing a stainless steel thermos, however, have ended up using it to clean a variety of items. This bottle brush works well and is durable, our first OXO Good Grips Bottle Brush lasted about 3 years and we just recently ordered a replacement. The bristles on these are soft/medium and definitely more intended to wash used beverage/drink containers than to scrape old dried food from a casserole dish. Would recommend these to anyone looking for a high quality bottle brush!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my rubbermaid container so far and it works great but it's not flexible so it doesn't go down the handle part is my only regret. Will be perfect for my long drinking cups with lids though. Price is right. Bristles are soft not hard if anyone cares. Works fine mostly for my long cups which is what I got it for. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Call me KID

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: I'm able to clean bottles and glasses and getting into small crevices, like around a screw top of a water bottle, or the inside of the lid of a water bottle. bristles softer than I expected, I don't know if that would be an issue for anyone
customer_reviews.author: D.Bass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cleaning the insides of Hydro Flask water bottles
customer_reviews.text: Just like my review says, this brush is excellent for cleaning the insides of Hydro Flask water bottles. In the past, I would have to use a chopstick and paper towels to clean my water bottles. I don't have to do that anymore now that I bought this very useful brush!
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: A great brush for me
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy for those bottles that you can’t seem to get with other brushes. This is not a flimsy brush. I also like that the bristles are strong but not stiff. Overall a great brush. I had no problems with with the delivery and it was as explained by the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Luvchocolat00

customer_reviews.title: Soft bristles.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is a little thin, making it a little too pliable and bendy. Bristles are very, very soft so it doesn't really scrub.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bdock

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for my needs
customer_reviews.text: We have many tall mugs that are very hard to get to the bottom and clean. I was hoping this would do the trick, due to the quality of OXO. It might be fine for baby bottles, but the item had too few bristles to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl W.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the sole purpose of cleaning my stainless steel water bottles. This brush works really well. Other brushes didn’t fit in the opening, making my water bottles hard to clean. This brush works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Shanda Douglas

customer_reviews.title: I totally agree with the "Flimsy" reviews
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in 2016 and it lasted 4 years. We loved it. Ordered the same again and it is flimsy with about 1/4 of the bristles. Sent it back. I also had to replace my OXO can opener for the second time. No more for me.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: No bristles on the tip, otherwise decent
customer_reviews.text: Fits most bottles, tight fit in thin mouthed bottles, but fits if forced. No bristles on the tip to clean the bottom of containers when you cannot maneuver laterally due to small opening. That's the only downfall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: the product is perfect for using half gallon glass milk bottle getting to the bottom and scrubbing them. use in cups and canteens. no issues at all had for over a year and one a week through it through the dishwasher on sanitize setting.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Tough Brush, Pair it with Dish Brush - Good Team!
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a long time. It's a durable and reliable brush. Family uses this one for bottles, cups, glasses, etc. Round shape is ideal and handle is good length. Bristles eventually splay but hold up for two or three years of regular use. Add the dish brush, with differently shaped head, and you can wash most anything.
customer_reviews.author: DRR

customer_reviews.title: Too big to fit into my bottles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my glass bottles that I'm using for kombucha, and the plastic head is too large to fit into the neck of the bottles. Other reviews seemed to state that it would be alright -but it's a no-go for me. :( It'll be fine for water bottles and such, however I bought this specifically to wash the glass bottles. Back to the drawing board I guess.
customer_reviews.author: perogeez

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: I had another bottle brush but it was very old and the bristles were coming out so I needed a new one and I know this brand it very good. I'm enjoying my brush a lot I'm glad I can finally was my water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Riding

customer_reviews.title: No Sports bottle should be without one.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, bristles and overall length allow cleaning for all the sports bottles and thermos it was purchased to clean. This request for review lists "suction" as a category. This is a bottle brush. It isn't supposed to suck.
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: The brush bristles are probably too soft to use as ...
customer_reviews.text: The brush bristles are probably too soft to use as the only dish scrubbing brush in your kitchen arsenal. BUT it does work really well if you just need gentle scrubbing. I've purchased this brush several times and never had any issues with parts breaking (like I've read from several other reviewers). Again, if you remember that this brush is only intended and effective as a bottle brush, you shouldn't be scrubbing anything hard enough to break the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Love My New Good Grips Bottle Brush!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised at the durability, quality, and flexibility of this brush. The bristles are soft yet edgy enough to really scrub any gunk off the insides of bottles or narrow glasses you cant get your hands and a sponge inside of. The handle is easy to hold with a very comfortable rubber ridged grip.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Barendse Elrod

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Bottle/Thermos/Glass Brush
customer_reviews.text: This brush is the perfect length and can fit easily into narrow openings. It also has nice flexibility to maneuver the brush around inside the bottle. It isn’t stuff like ones I had in the past. I’d highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Crappy bottle brush
customer_reviews.text: Crappy bottle brush, bristles are too soft. Also small cleaning area, way too much handle and not enough bristles. If my husband had not destroyed the packaging I would return it. As it is, it's going straight into the trash!
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it does -- cleaning bottles. I have been using this for a few weeks now, and have had no issues, although it can be a little difficult to remove the dirty stuff from the bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Cat

customer_reviews.title: Best I could find, just not up to quality of original model
customer_reviews.text: I have had the older model for years and the bristles finally gave out. I ordered this one as I thought it would be the same. It has much softer and maybe 1/3 less bristles than the original. It is good but nowhere near as good as the old one. I put it in the drawer and decided to get a bit more service out of the old one. It is hard to find a bristle type brush with bristles on the end. There are many foam ones out there, but they are just germ breeding grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Pictureman

customer_reviews.title: Great for plasticware
customer_reviews.text: I love this brush. It is strong enough to reach in and scrub the junk but soft enough that it does not scratch the plastic items. We all take lunch to work and at the end of the day, we have a ton of plasticware to wash. We all love this brush. It also creates a good lather. It does not become stained as it gets old. I hope that this product is around for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: WorkingTowardsBetter

customer_reviews.title: long handle
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy to have purchased this brush. The longer handle is a huge plus. It works well in all our different style bottles and thermal mugs. The bristle are full thick and sturdy without being too harsh for any container, the blue tip bristles are slightly stiffer and longer, perfect for those nooks that some containers have at the very bottom. I will definitely repurchase in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DiGoose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for metal water bottles
customer_reviews.text: I was having some real issues properly cleaning my water bottles until I bought this. The blue bristles at the tip are great for scrubbing the very bottom of a tall metal bottle, without damaging the coating.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Peace

customer_reviews.title: like it gets bitten by a spider and turns into ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an effective bottle brush, and it seems well constructed. It didn't cost any more or less than at a retail store, so I snagged it with a recent water bottle purchase. I'm sure you can find something of similar quality at a similar price at retail, but if you're going to buy one anyway you might as well grab it here while you're purchasing other things and get it delivered. I don't think it will fall apart anytime soon. I'll update if something crazy happens, like it gets bitten by a spider and turns into a radioactive superhero for dishes or something.
customer_reviews.author: PAPASTAG

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this brush. When it arrived the bristles were a slight brownish color rather than white and it has only become more and more brown with very minimal use. It’s also very flimsy and ineffective for its intended purpose due to the extremely soft bristles. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, effective
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to clean drinking glasses that I use for smoothies. If you've ever left one sitting around after you're done, you know it can be pretty difficult to remove the little bits that harden like cement on the glass. After briefly soaking your glassware, this brush works beautifully! It also smooshes down to a pretty small diameter (an inch or so?) so it's effective for most sizes. The bristles are fairly soft. I can't imagine they would scratch anything. I've been using it frequently for about 10 days and haven't lost a bristle. It also rinses clean quite easily. Now, get into that kitchen and wash some dishes!
customer_reviews.author: forager

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Bottle Brush, 12"H
product_meta.description:
With a dual-function bristle head designed for gentle cleaning and serious scrubbing, and a long neck flexes with ease, reaching those tough-to-get areas inside bottles, pitchers and carafes. The OXO Good Grips Bottle Brush is more than your average kitchen scrubber. The handle provides a soft non-slip grip, even when wet. Dishwasher safe, store it in your sink caddy or hang it from a hook. Safe for pots and pans, stemware, baby bottles and other delicate containers.

AMAZON.COM
With two types of bristles and a flexible neck, the bottle brush by Oxo is the ultimate weapon in cleaning skinny bottles and narrow jars. Because of the brush's flexible neck and rounded head, nooks and crannies are easy to get to and get clean. The nonslip handle stays firmly in place--even under running water--and absorbs pressure and tension away from hands. --Laurie Notaro

BRAND STORY
By

See more
feature_bullets: Long, durable neck flexes for easy reach inside bottles, pitchers and carafes
Stiff blue bristles give hard to reach corners a serious scrub, while white bristles are gentle enough to clean wine glasses and crystal without scratching

Soft, non slip handle provides a comfortable grip, even when wet.The OXO Better Guarantee: If you experience an issue with your OXO product, get in touch with us for a repair or replacement. We're grateful for the opportunity to learn from your experience, and we'll make it better.Also great for stemware, pint glasses, baby bottles and other delicate containers
Easily stored in a kitchen caddy or hung from a hook. Dishwasher safe
Dimensions (Overall): 12.5 inches (H) x 2.3 inches (W) x 2.3 inches (D)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars12,158 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
